Topic.Title: .28 cents consensus?

Message.Msg: NYSI - Closed at +941. Above +1000 it gets hot. Above +1000 with MACD 200 is Sahara Desert. NYA50R - Percent of NYSE stocks trading above 50-day MA closed at 89%. Red Coal Hot! SPXA50R - Percent of S&P 500 stocks trading above 50-day MA closed at 93%. Red Coal Hot! BPSPX - S&P Bullish Percentage Index based on P&F charts used by NYSE technicians closed at 79%, just a tad shy of 80% overbought indicator. Too many bulls at the NYSE. VIX - While the Spot VIX is in the dumpster with 12 handle, the futures curve has also collapsed and continues to move lower. Feb at 14.05. Mar at 15.40. Apr at 16.05. May at 17.10. There is no fear looking out several months. We haven't had NYSE Tick reading below +1000 since Christmas. In other words, even during days when market was slightly weak, the number of NYSE issues advancing vs. declining has consistently remained above 1000 for four weeks. Last time the streak was this long was in mid-2007. Another stat (courtesy of Bespoke) is that during last 5 years, there have been only 2 days (Oct 27 and 28 in 2011) when the number of overbought stocks in S&P were higher than today (398). Subsequently, S&P corrected 9% within a month. On the flip side, the two indicators that bulls point out lately is incredible outperformance of Transports (IYT) and Small Caps (IWM) relative to S&P. See under Sector Performance. The argument goes that as long as these are outpacing S&P, this rally can remain intact. I can understand that, but there is no historic precedent to suggest that market can't pull back, say 3-5%, to neutralize some of these overbought market internals when IYT and IWM are outperforming.

Topic.Title: .28 cents consensus?

Message.Msg: The question that we need to ask is what is the catalyst for pull back? Quite frankly, given current state of overbought internals I was hoping it would be negative reaction to GOOG and IBM earnings, which was part of the thought process before I sent out those earnings plays. But clearly the S&P has different agenda in mind. Just quickly regarding those earnings, GOOG got hammered in Oct when it reported deceleration in paid clicks. This time further deceleration doesn't seem to matter. IBM got hammered in Oct for deterioration in order bookings. This time 13% decline in bookings doesn't seem to matter. The same talking heads who were trashing these stocks in Oct now seem to love them despite further cracks in quality of earnings. Three months ago S&P Q4 earnings growth expectation was 9%. Today it is 3% and as companies beat the low bar, everyone is cheering. That's what happens when investors cloud their judgement on fundamentals by simply looking at stock price action. I guarantee that if GOOG shares had dropped, the same pundits who were cheering the fundamentals after hours would have been trashing them. Back to market internals -- a few more recently issued macro data points. The Richmond, New York and Philly Fed Index missed expectations by a mile as reported in last two weeks, the worst reading in five months. The Citi Macro Index, which has an impeccable track record in forecasting turns in S&P 500, turned negative for the first time since April 2012. Courtesty of Zerohedge, this is presented in the first chart below. Once again, what is the catalyst that will cause market correction? Perhaps Credit Suisse gives us some hints as following: "There is an 89% correlation between forward-year EPS revision and the market performance in February. Our expectation is for 2013 EPS consensus to be revised down by 3% from $112.57 to $109.30 over the next three months." So market sell-off in February? Fahad

Message.Title: Going back to the basics
Message.Msg: A phone is a phone, smart phone may not seem too smart in this economy condition, I wouldn't be surprised if we see the basic phone comes back in the next a few years - do you know how many people are actually using a phone to surf internet? paying every month using an iPhone for your car's navigation vs buying a GPS device, who do you think will win?...Trying to bundle all 'features' in one device with high monthly charge doesn't look have a bright future, haven't we forgotten why Google beat the #$%$ out of Yahoo? If you say Apple will be next Microsoft, you are too optimistic, I can predict that in 10 years Microsoft will still be here to stay, for Apple, I can only pray.

Topic.Title: I NEED serious advise please !!!!

Message.Msg: I won't tell you what to do, but if my timeline was long (several years) I wouldn't sell; in fact, I'm not selling and haven't sold for several years! (It's not a loss until you sell it). Sooner of later it will come back up - that's how it works. Next time place a stop-loss so you don't lose more than you are comfortable with. That's an easier fix if you are nervous. A lot of good people have lost money trying to time the market - my best advice is to do your research and then let it ride; at least, that's what I do. Best of luck, Homeboy.

Topic.Title: I NEED serious advise please !!!!

Message.Msg: I sold Apple at 680 last September and told everyone in this board that Apple was going down to 300-400 range.Boy,was my prediction right.I sold 10,600 shares.I put all that Apple money into Nokia and RIMM.Instead of loosing money,I gained 135% so far.I bought Nokia at 2.57 and I hold 2.75 Million Nokia shares.Bought 80K of RIMM but sold it at 12.40 and will wait till BB10 is launched to gauge RIMM long term feasibility.I was tempted to get back into RIMM last week but I'm glad I used my head instead of following my emotions. Here is your answer.The reason I sold all Apple shares and put all the money into Nokia was very simple for me.Nokia has a better smartphone.The Nokia Lumia 920 which I owned is the best smartphone in the world and Apple is simply not innovating after Steve Jobs death.In my opinion,the smartphone war in 2013 will be between Nokia and Samsung.Nokia is going to see the biggest growth rate of any Hardware manufacturer including Samsung in the next 5 years.Nokia has restructured,is launching 8 Lumia smartphones at every price range which gives consumers choice of smartphone and price.Nokia has also won a coup by signing a contract with China Mobile the largest carrier which Apple tried but couldn't and Nokia Lumia 920 provides China mobile the Elite smartphone they were looking for to retain their customers.Nokia went further and signed another contract with China Unicom,the second largest China Carrier.Both China Mobile and China Unicom are offering Lumia smartphones at 1 Yuan (almost zero) with contracts.Apple with its casha and big name could not achieve that.Why? Its not only the Chinese Carriers that are after Nokia smartphones,all U.S carriers are promoting Nokia smartphones over the Apple's iphone because all carriers over the world are loosing money over Apple's iphone and want competition.This is why Apple is on down spiral.Carriers find its products too expensive and Apple is no longer innovating.Buy Nokia and you gain 400% in 2013.

Message.Title: Very bullish earnings call
Message.Msg: If you are long, ignore all the negative posts and big drop after hours and consider these points: 1. They could not meet demand for all products due to supply constraints but still managed to announce EPS and Revenue in-line of analyst expectations....this is not a growth issue 2. China is showing triple digits growth.....over $7B in revenue from China in one quarter 3. $16B cash added during Q1 4. Shorter quarter by one week or 7%...many people are missing this point Here is something for you to read taken directly from the earnings call: Katy Huberty - Morgan Stanley And then maybe a question for Peter, with such a large cash generation again this quarter and confidence in the product pipeline, you made those comments in a stock price that is off at highs, why not step up and buyback even more stock than you had originally planned at this point? Peter Oppenheimer Sure. Kate, this is something that we continuously #$%$ the opportunities to both invest in the business and return cash. We are pleased to have started our share repurchase program this quarter. And combined with our dividend, we returned about $4.5 billion of cash this quarter and we started the buyback program and expect to return about $45 billion over three years to our shareholders. We do consider increasing these programs and we’ll do what we think is in the best interest of our shareholders.

Message.Title: Buybacks are for suckers, dividends are for shareholders
Message.Msg: Buybacks are just a way for management to use profits to give themselves more stock options. Yes, some companies actually reduce the shares outstanding, but not many. Now consider Cook sells virtually all his shares as soon as they vest so never collects a dividend...which way do you think Apple will go with all the cash on hand larger dividend to reward shareholders or buybacks to reward the big wigs who get more stock options out of it? My bet is buybacks so Cook can give himself 100K more options for the "great" job he is doing. Check out the filings from last March if you dont believe me, of the hundreds of thousands of shares he's been "awarded" over the years he has 10K shares left, sold hundreds of thousands as soon as he could, and has hundreds of thousands more that will vest over the coming years...all for doing exactly what? Rolling out the iPhone5?

Topic.Title: I NEED serious advise please !!!!

Message.Msg: a. if you sell tomorrow morning, the last thing you want to do is put the money you have left into another equally risky play. Shorting an extremely volatile stock with money you can't afford to lose is a great way to go broke. If you sell, invest the remaining money into a broad based index fund and high grade bonds,, so as to ensure income and minimize future losses. b. apple is a very good, highly profitable company, but it is not in favor with the market right now, and no one knows when sentiment will change or what the catalyst will be. if you hold the stock and reinvest the dividends, you will probably come out on top, but you will need to change your time horizon from short to long term. This option is a much more risky move than what I recommend in A., since all your money will be tied up in one company.

Get your money out and pay as much of that loan as possible. Then get back to making money the old-fashioned way - work. Consider it a really good lesson and feel lucky that it could've been a lot worse. At the risk of stating the obvious, if you invest money that absolutely need by a certain date, it's no longer investing - it's gambling.

Topic.Title: does anyone remember when iPhone5 had no waiting period to order online?...

Message.Msg: Announced September 12, the iPhone 5 features a bigger screen, lighter and slimmer frame, faster processor and, for the first time, 4G LTE wireless connections. If a handful of tech writers were unimpressed with the specs, that didn't translate into lack of consumer interest. Apple took 2 million pre-orders for the phone in the first 24 hours they were available last week, and some analysts think it could sell more than 10 million by Monday.
